intro: Nicandra anomala, commonly known as the sweet pepper vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a slightly hairy texture. Nicandra anomala is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
